meanings.definition: To transfer goods from one ship or mode of transportation to another.
meanings.sent1: The workers will transship the cargo from the boat to the truck.
meanings.sent2: It is common for companies to transship products between different vessels.
meanings.sent3: The pirates tried to transship the treasure, but ended up dropping it in the sea!
meanings.sent4: She had to transship her luggage from the train to the bus in a hurry.
meanings.sent5: The crane operator carefully transshipped the containers onto the waiting ship.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring goods from one ship or mode of transportation to another.
meanings.sent1: The transship of the goods was completed smoothly at the port.
meanings.sent2: Transship is an essential process in the logistics industry.
meanings.sent3: The transship of the animals to the zoo was quite an adventure!
meanings.sent4: The transship of knowledge from one generation to the next is vital for progress.
meanings.sent5: The transship of passengers from the plane to the shuttle was efficient and quick.
